description: [Vanguard] Poland's President Andrzej Duda said "very many" immigrants come to Europe expecting a free ride, in an interview aired Sunday on a US political affairs programme.
title: Africa: Japa - Many Immigrants Come to Europe Thinking 'Life Is Easier' - Poland President

description: [Namibian] The Paris Paralympics closed on Sunday with chief Paris 2024 organiser Tony Estanguet saying the Games and the Olympics had created a "historic summer".
title: Africa: Paris Paralympics Close After 'Historic Summer'

description: [Tunis Afrique Presse] Tunis -- President Kais Saied met Prime Minister Kamel Madouri at Carthage Palace on Monday to review Tunisia's participation in the recent China-Africa summit in Beijing.
title: Africa: President Saied Reviews Tunisia's Participation in China-Africa Summit With Prime Minister

description: [IPS] In the landscape of African nonprofit organisations and indeed the world over, sustainability remains a cornerstone for enduring impact. However, continued funding is a pivotal aspect of sustainability.
title: Africa: Partnership-Building - a Sustainable Tool for African Non-Profit Organisations

description: [UN News] A milestone declaration to accelerate investment in the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) as well as three resolutions on the Gaza conflict were among the achievements of the 78th session of the UN General Assembly, outgoing president Dennis Francis said on Monday in New York.
title: Africa: Outgoing General Assembly President 'Bullish On the UN', Despite Mounting Crises

description: [UN News] Cluster bomblets continue to kill thousands of civilians, mostly children, and the new use of this predominantly outlawed class of weapons is threatening efforts to universally ban them, according to a new report published on Monday.
title: Africa: New Use of Cluster Bombs Threatens Global Ban, Report Warns

description: [UN News] As conflicts grow more complex and armed groups increasingly weaponize low-cost technologies like improvised explosive devices and drones, UN peacekeeping missions need greater political support and resources to carry out their duties safely, a senior UN official said on Monday.
title: Africa: UN Peacekeepers Saving Lives but Need Stronger Political Support and Resources, Top Official Urges

description: [UN News] The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights delivered his annual global update on Monday, urging the international community to reject a "new normal" that upholds entrenched power structures at the expense of our common humanity.
title: Africa: Reconnect With Our Common Humanity and Reject 'Treacherous New Normal'

description: [UN News] Recent years have seen a dramatic increase in the number of attacks on students, teachers and schools, resulting in an "incalculable cost" for children affected by conflict around the world, Secretary-General António Guterres said in a message commemorating the International Day to Protect Education from Attack on Monday.
title: Africa: 'Incalculable Cost' of Conflict On the Lives of Children

description: [African Union] H.E. Robert Beugré Mambé, Prime Minister of Côte d'Ivoire, and H.E. Josephine Mayuma Kala, Special Representative of the AU Commission Chairperson to Côte d'Ivoire, on behalf of the Chairperson, will jointly launch the 2024 edition of the Abidjan Border Forum, at 3:00 pm GMT on 10 September 2024 at the auditorium of the prime minister's office in Abidjan.
title: Africa: Press Release - African Union and Côte d'Ivoire Jointly Launch 2024 Edition of Abidjan Border Forum
Africa: Partners in Crisis Response and Prevention

description: [Afropop] Sidi Samb is a veteran Senegalese bandleader who has long made his home in Spain, where he developed a deep love for and familiarity with flamenco music and dance. Samb has been leading his own band Afroflamenco for over 20 years, and finally, the band is coming to the United States this fall, including a stop at Joe's Pub in New York on September 21. At WOMEX in 2022, Afropop's Banning Eyre had a chance to chat with Sidi Samb about the band. Here's their conversation.
title: Africa: Sidi Samb's Afroflamenco Debuts in America

description: [The Conversation Africa] Rating agency Fitch recently warned that the rapid spread of the mpox virus in sub-Saharan Africa could add to the fiscal pressures many countries in the region are already experiencing.
title: Africa: Rating Agencies and Africa - the Absence of People On the Ground Contributes to Bias Against the Continent - Analyst
